title: ggblanket
text: ggblanket package wrapper functions around fantastic ggplot2 package. primary objective simplify ggplot2 visualisation. Secondary objectives relate : Scope: cover useful 80% ggplot2 Design: produce well-designed visualisation default Alignment: use conventions generally aligned ggplot2. intended useful levels experience beginner expert.
code: library(ggblanket) library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) library(stringr) library(palmerpenguins)

title: ggblanket
text: simplify ggplot2 visualisation, ggblanket package provides: gg_* wrapper functions plot single geom single col argument colour fill variable facet argument facet variable additional facet2 argument facet second variable pal argument customise colours Prefixed arguments customise scales, guides, titles faceting Default titles converted snakecase::to_sentence Numeric limits default min max break Horizontal plots y labels order etc pal generally inherits subsequent geoms Access geom_* arguments via ... theme argument customise look feel gg_theme function create quick theme base create custom plot functions defaults Supports ggiraph interactivity gg_blank add_tooltip

what: 1. gg_* wrapper functions to plot a single geom
title: ggblanket
text: gg_*functions wrap ggplot2 ggplot(aes(...)) function applicable ggplot2 geom_*() function. aesthetics (text) within ggplot function, therefore inherit subsequent geom’s added default. Always pipe data, can access variable names Rstudio autocomplete.
code: iris |>   mutate(Species = str_to_sentence(Species)) |>    gg_point(     x = Sepal.Width,      y = Sepal.Length,      col = Species)

what: 2.A single col argument to colour and fill by a variable
title: ggblanket
text: {ggblanket} merges col fill aesthetics ggplot2 one concept represented col argument. ggplot2 language, argument always represents col fill.
code: penguins |>    gg_histogram(     x = body_mass_g,      col = species)

what: 3. A facet argument to facet by a variable
title: ggblanket
text: faceting treated essentially aesthetic, users just provide unquoted variable facet . single facet (facet2) variable provided, ’ll default “wrap” layout. can change facet_layout = "grid" argument.
code: penguins |>    tidyr::drop_na(sex) |>   mutate(sex = str_to_sentence(sex)) |>   gg_violin(     x = sex,      y = body_mass_g,      facet = species)

what: 4. An additional facet2 argument to facet by a second variable
title: ggblanket
text: facet2 argument also provided extra functionality flexibility. facetand facet2 variables provided, ’ll default “grid” layout facet facet2. can change facet_layout = "wrap" argument.
code: penguins |>   tidyr::drop_na(sex) |>   mutate(sex = str_to_sentence(sex)) |>    gg_density(     x = flipper_length_mm,     col = sex,     facet = species,     facet2 = island   )

what: 5. A pal argument to customise colours
title: ggblanket
text: pal argument allows users pick vector colours want. arguments work way regardless whether col variable specified .
code: penguins |>    mutate(sex = str_to_sentence(sex)) |>    group_by(species, sex) |>    summarise(body_mass_g = mean(body_mass_g, na.rm = TRUE)) |>    gg_col(     x = species,      y = body_mass_g,      col = sex,      position = position_dodge2(preserve = "single"),     pal = c("#1B9E77", "#9E361B"))

what: 6. Prefixed arguments to customise scales, guides, titles and faceting
title: ggblanket
text: prefixed arguments designed work Rstudio autocomplete help remember find adjustment need. Determine whether want change relates x,y, col facet, type prefix press tab key access list autocomplete. use arrow keys, press tab select. Available arguments : *_breaks: Adjust breaks scale *_expand: Adjust padding beyond limits scale *_include: Include value within scale *_labels: Adjust labels breaks scale *_limits: Adjust limits scale *_trans: Transform scale (e.g. “log10”, “sqrt” “reverse”) *_title: Add title *_sec_axis: Add secondary x y axis *_grid: Add remove x y gridline col_continuous colour continuous variable (e.g. “steps”) col_rescale: Rescale continuous col variable non-linearly col_legend_place: Place put legend (e.g. “r”) col_legend_ncol: Number columns arrange legend elements col_legend_nrow: Number rows arrange legend elements col_legend_rev: Whether reverse legend facet_layout: Whether layout “wrap” “grid” facet_scales: facet scales treated facet_space: Whether facet space allocated proportionally facet_ncol: many columns wrap facets facet_nrow: many rows wrap facets
code: penguins |>   gg_jitter(     x = species,     y = body_mass_g,     col = flipper_length_mm,     col_continuous = "steps",     y_include = 0,     y_trans = "sqrt",     y_breaks = scales::breaks_width(1500),      y_labels = scales::label_number()   )

title: ggblanket
text: make quicker get plot titles good external people see, often work nicely snakecase column names. titles need change manually, can change manually using x_title, y_title, col_title. remove titles, can use x_title = "" within gg_* function equivalent y col titles.
code: penguins |>   group_by(species, sex) |>   summarise(     flipper_length_mm = round(mean(flipper_length_mm, na.rm = TRUE), 0)) |>   gg_tile(     x = sex,      y = species,      col = flipper_length_mm,      width = 0.9,     height = 0.9,     pal = rev(pals::brewer.rdbu(9)),      col_legend_place = "r",     col_rescale = c(186, 215, 222),     x_labels = snakecase::to_sentence_case,     title = "Average penguin body mass",     subtitle = "Palmer Archipelago, Antarctica",     theme = gg_theme(plot_background_pal = "white",                      axis_line_pal = "white",                       axis_ticks_pal = "white")) +   geom_text(aes(label = flipper_length_mm), col = "#232323", size = 3.5)

what: 8. Numeric limits that default to the min and max break
title: ggblanket
text: default x y scales designed create symmetry. y numeric, y limits default max y breaks zero y expanding. similar x scale, y character/factor/logical x numeric. revert min/max data, use *_limits = c(NA, NA) *_limits = c(lubridate::NA_Date_, lubridate::NA_Date_).
code: storms |>   group_by(year) |>   filter(between(year, 1980, 2020)) |>   summarise(wind = mean(wind, na.rm = TRUE)) |>   gg_line(     x = year,     y = wind,     x_labels = scales::label_number(big.mark = ""),     y_include = 0,     title = "Storm wind speed",     subtitle = "USA average storm wind speed, 1980\u20132020",     y_title = "Wind speed (knots)",     caption = "Source: NOAA"   ) +   geom_point()

what: 9. Horizontal plots with y labels in order etc
title: ggblanket
text: plots horizontal, ggblanket ensures y labels order. position bars, pal colours legend elements mostly right order .
code: penguins |>   tidyr::drop_na(sex) |>    group_by(species, sex, island) |>   summarise(body_mass_kg = mean(body_mass_g) / 1000) |>   gg_col(     x = body_mass_kg,      y = species,      col = sex,      facet = island,     width = 0.75,     col_labels = snakecase::to_sentence_case,      position = "dodge")

what: 10. A pal that inherits to subsequent geoms
title: ggblanket
text: pal generally inherited subsequent geom layers regardless whether col argument. ‘hood’, dummy col fill aesmthetic variables added, colour scale added legend turned . approach can cause challenges. discussed ‘Multiple geom layers’ section. Note alpha inherit.
code: penguins |>   gg_boxplot(x = species,              y = body_mass_g,              width = 0.5,              pal = "#1B9E77",               outlier.colour = NA) +   geom_jitter()

what: 11. Access to other geom_* arguments via ...
title: ggblanket
text: relates arguments mapping argument aesthetics. Common arguments add size, linewidth width. arguments can identified help relevant ggplot2::geom_* function.
code: penguins |>   tidyr::drop_na(sex) |>   gg_smooth(     x = flipper_length_mm,     y = body_mass_g,     col = sex,     size = 0.5,      level = 0.99,      col_legend_place = "t",     col_title = "",      col_labels = snakecase::to_sentence_case   )

what: 12. A theme argument to customise the look and feel
title: ggblanket
text: allows utilise simplicity ggblanket, making content required look feel. using theme argument, theme control theme aspects, magic relating legend gridline removal within gg_* function. : col_legend_place argument work regardless theme provided theme argument theme gridlines directions can provided get generally appropriate gridlines automatically (e.g. vertical gridlines horizontal bar plots). However… want magic want theme adjust everything, just add theme layer instead (e.g. + theme_grey()).
code: penguins |>   mutate(sex = str_to_sentence(sex)) |>    gg_point(x = bill_depth_mm,            y = bill_length_mm,            col = sex,            facet = species,             pal = c("#1B9E77", "#9E361B"),             theme = theme_grey())

what: 13. A gg_theme function to create a quick theme
title: ggblanket
text: gg_theme function allows modify default theme changing text size, colours, margins, among . includes arguments adjusting text, background colours, axis lines, ticks gridlines. also void = TRUE argument useful maps.
code: storms |>   group_by(year) |>   filter(between(year, 1980, 2020)) |>   summarise(wind = mean(wind, na.rm = TRUE)) |>   gg_col(     x = year,     y = wind,     x_labels = scales::label_comma(big.mark = ""),     x_expand = c(0, 0),     width = 0.75,     theme = gg_theme(       text_size = 11,       plot_background_pal = "white",       panel_background_pal = "white"))

what: 14. A base from which to create custom plot functions with your own defaults
title: ggblanket
text: can easily create powerful custom functions. ... argument can allow access arguments within ggblanket gg_* function (applicable ggplot2::geom_* function).
code: gg_point_custom <- function(data, x, y, col,                              size = 3,                              shape = 17,                             pal = pals::brewer.dark2(9),                              col_title = "",                              col_legend_place = "t",                             ...) {   data |>      gg_point(x = {{ x }}, y = {{ y }}, col = {{col}},               size = size,               shape = shape,              pal = pal,               col_title = col_title,               col_legend_place = col_legend_place,               ...) }  iris |>   mutate(Species = str_to_sentence(Species)) |>    gg_point_custom(     x = Sepal.Width,     y = Sepal.Length,     col = Species,      title = "Edgar Anderson's iris data",     subtitle = "Iris sepal length by width and species",     caption = "Edgar Anderson, 1935"   )

what: 15. Supports ggiraph interactivity with gg_blank and add_tooltip
title: ggblanket
text: ggblanket supports ggiraph interactivity gg_blank add_tooltip functions. Users use similar approach plotly::ggplotly, prefer.
code: df <- iris |>   tibble::tibble() |>   add_tooltip(Sepal.Width, Sepal.Length, Species)  df |>    head(1)  p <- iris |>   add_tooltip(tidyselect::contains("Sepal"), Species) |>   mutate(id = row_number()) |>   gg_blank(x = Sepal.Width,            y = Sepal.Length,            col = Species,            facet = Species) +   ggiraph::geom_point_interactive(aes(tooltip = tooltip, data_id = id))  girafe(   ggobj = p,   width_svg = 5,   height_svg = 4,   options = list(opts_hover(css = "fill:red; stroke: red")) )

title: ggblanket
text: plots multiple geom’s, need think desired drawing order want, choose gg_* function permits order. plots geoms acol aesthetic , must choose gg_* function relates one layers col argument. , conflicts desired drawing order, choose gg_blank (.e. col argument). reason ggblanket hood creates dummy colour scale col argument. know gg_* function going use, might need use *_include argument adjust x y scale include range needed subsequent layers. subsequent layers require aesthetics gg_* function, use inherit.aes = FALSE argument geom_* function. example, make coloured column graph grey error bars, use gg_col function layer col aesthetic drawing order means underneath errorbars.
code: df <- data.frame(   trt = factor(c(1, 1, 2, 2)),   resp = c(1, 5, 3, 4),   group = factor(c(1, 2, 1, 2)),   upper = c(1.1, 5.3, 3.3, 4.2),   lower = c(0.8, 4.6, 2.4, 3.6) )  df |>    gg_col(     x = trt,     y = resp,     col = group,     position = "dodge",     y_include = max(df$upper)    ) +   geom_errorbar(     aes(x = trt, ymin = lower, ymax = upper, group = group),     inherit.aes = FALSE,     col = "#7F7F7F",     position = position_dodge(width = 0.9),     width = 0.1     )

title: ggblanket
text: gg_* functions directly support aesthetics alpha, size, linewidth, shape, linetype. However, use gg_blank addition col argument, add title new aesthetic align col_title.  ggblanket keeps x y --bound values (.e. uses scales::oob_keep hood). However, can zoom using coord = coord_cartesian(xlim = ..., ylim = ...) (filtering data).  ggplot2 functionality unsupported ggblanket, can add applicable ggplot2 layer ggblanket code. example, using + facet_grid(..., switch = "y").  functionality supported ggblanket. cannon access non-default computed variables. geom’s supported (e.g. geom_contour, geom_density_2d). also colour date, datetime time variable. situations need use ggplot2.
code: penguins |>    gg_blank(x = flipper_length_mm, y = body_mass_g, col = species) +   geom_point(aes(shape = species)) +   labs(shape = "Species") penguins |>    gg_point(     x = flipper_length_mm,      y = body_mass_g,      coord = coord_cartesian(xlim = c(190, 200)),     x_breaks = scales::breaks_width(2)) penguins |>   tidyr::drop_na() |>   mutate(sex = str_to_sentence(sex)) |>   gg_jitter(     x = sex,      y = body_mass_g,     col = sex,      size = 1,      x_title = "",     y_limits = c(NA, NA)) +   facet_grid(cols = vars(species),              rows = vars(island),               switch = "y") diamonds |>    ggplot() +   geom_density2d(aes(x = carat, y = price, colour = after_stat(level))) +   scale_colour_gradientn(colours = viridis::viridis(9)) +   scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0, 0), limits = c(0, 6000)) +   labs(x = "Carat", y = "Price", colour = "Level") +   gg_theme() +   theme(panel.grid.major.x = element_blank()) +   theme(legend.position = "right") +   theme(legend.direction = "vertical")

title: Add a tooltip column — add_tooltip
text: data data frame tibble. ... Arguments passed select (.e unquoted variables, tidyselect helpers etc). arguments provided, uses columns. titles function format variable names, including rlang lambda format. name name column created. Defaults "tooltip".

title: Add a tooltip column — add_tooltip
text: data frame tibble column text

title: Add a tooltip column — add_tooltip
code:
library(ggplot2) iris %>% add_tooltip() %>% head(1) #> Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species #> 1 5.1 3.5 1.4 0.2 setosa #> tooltip #> 1 Sepal length: 5.1
Sepal width: 3.5
Petal length: 1.4
Petal width: 0.2
Species: setosa iris %>% add_tooltip(tidyselect::contains("Sepal"), Species) %>% head(1) #> Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species #> 1 5.1 3.5 1.4 0.2 setosa #> tooltip #> 1 Sepal length: 5.1
Sepal width: 3.5

title: Polygon ggplot — gg_polygon
code: library(ggplot2)  ids <- factor(c("1.1", "2.1", "1.2", "2.2", "1.3", "2.3"))  values <- data.frame(   id = ids,   value = c(3, 3.1, 3.1, 3.2, 3.15, 3.5) )  positions <- data.frame(   id = rep(ids, each = 4),   x = c(2, 1, 1.1, 2.2, 1, 0, 0.3, 1.1, 2.2, 1.1, 1.2, 2.5, 1.1, 0.3,         0.5, 1.2, 2.5, 1.2, 1.3, 2.7, 1.2, 0.5, 0.6, 1.3),   y = c(-0.5, 0, 1, 0.5, 0, 0.5, 1.5, 1, 0.5, 1, 2.1, 1.7, 1, 1.5,         2.2, 2.1, 1.7, 2.1, 3.2, 2.8, 2.1, 2.2, 3.3, 3.2) )  datapoly <- merge(values, positions, by = c("id"))  datapoly %>%   gg_polygon(x = x,              y = y,              col = value,              group = id)   holes <-   do.call(rbind, lapply(split(datapoly, datapoly$id), function(df) {     df$x <- df$x + 0.5 * (mean(df$x) - df$x)     df$y <- df$y + 0.5 * (mean(df$y) - df$y)     df   }))  datapoly$subid <- 1L holes$subid <- 2L datapoly <- rbind(datapoly, holes)  datapoly %>%   gg_polygon(     x = x,     y = y,     col = value,     group = id,     subgroup = subid   )

title: Smooth ggplot — gg_smooth
code: library(ggplot2)  gg_smooth(mpg, x = displ, y = hwy) #> `geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula = 'y ~ x' #> `geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula = 'y ~ x'   gg_smooth(mpg, x = displ, y = hwy) +   geom_point() #> `geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula = 'y ~ x' #> `geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula = 'y ~ x'   gg_smooth(mpg, x = hwy, y = displ) +   geom_point() #> `geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula = 'y ~ x' #> `geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula = 'y ~ x'   gg_smooth(mpg, x = hwy, y = displ, orientation = "y") +   geom_point() #> `geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula = 'y ~ x' #> `geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula = 'y ~ x'   gg_smooth(mpg, x = displ, y = hwy, method = "lm") +   geom_point() #> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x' #> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'

title: Violin ggplot — gg_violin
text: data data frame tibble. x Unquoted x aesthetic variable. y Unquoted y aesthetic variable. col Unquoted col fill aesthetic variable. facet Unquoted facet aesthetic variable. facet2 Unquoted second facet variable facet grid facet facet2 variables. group Unquoted group aesthetic variable. text Unquoted text aesthetic variable, can used combination plotly::ggplotly(., tooltip = "text"). stat Statistical transformation. character string (e.g. "identity"). position Position adjustment. Either character string (e.g."identity"), function (e.g. ggplot2::position_identity()). pal Colours use. character vector hex codes (names). pal_na Colour use NA values. character vector hex code (name). alpha Opacity. number 0 1. ... arguments passed relevant ggplot2::geom_* function. titles function format x, y col titles. Defaults snakecase::to_sentence_case. title Title string. subtitle Subtitle string. coord Coordinate system. x_breaks function limits (e.g. scales::breaks_pretty()), vector breaks. x_expand Padding limits ggplot2::expansion function, vector length 2 (e.g. c(0, 0)). x_grid TRUE FALSE vertical x gridlines. NULL guesses based classes x y. x_include numeric date variable, values scale include (e.g. 0). x_labels function takes breaks inputs (e.g. scales::label_comma()), vector labels. x_limits vector length 2 determine limits axis. Alternatively, zoom using coord = coord_cartesian(xlim = ...). x_sec_axis secondary axis using ggplot2::sec_axis ggplot2::dup_axis function. x_title Axis title string. Defaults converting sentence case spaces. Use "" title. x_trans numeric variable, transformation object (e.g. "log10", "sqrt" "reverse"). y_breaks function limits (e.g. scales::breaks_pretty()), vector breaks. y_expand Padding limits ggplot2::expansion function, vector length 2 (e.g. c(0, 0)). y_grid TRUE FALSE horizontal y gridlines. NULL guesses based classes x y. y_include numeric date variable, values scale include (e.g. 0). y_labels function takes breaks inputs (e.g. scales::label_comma()), vector labels. y_limits vector length 2 determine limits axis. Alternatively, zoom using coord = coord_cartesian(ylim = ...). y_sec_axis secondary axis using ggplot2::sec_axis ggplot2::dup_axis function. y_title Axis title string. Defaults converting sentence case spaces. Use "" title. y_trans numeric variable, transformation object (e.g. "log10", "sqrt" "reverse"). col_breaks function limits (e.g. scales::breaks_pretty()), vector breaks. col_continuous Type colouring continuous variable. Either "gradient" "steps". Defaults "steps" - just first letter e.g. "g". col_include numeric date variable, values scale include (e.g. 0). col_labels function takes breaks inputs (e.g. scales::label_comma()), vector labels. Note affect col_intervals NULL. col_legend_place place legend. Either "bottom", "right", "top" "left" - just first letter e.g. "b". col_legend_ncol number columns legend elements. col_legend_nrow number rows legend elements. col_legend_rev Reverse elements legend. Defaults FALSE. col_limits vector determine limits colour scale. col_rescale continuous col variable, vector rescale pal non-linearly. col_title Legend title string. Defaults converting sentence case spaces. Use "" title. col_trans numeric variable, transformation object (e.g. "log10", "sqrt" "reverse"). facet_labels function takes breaks inputs (e.g. scales::label_comma()), named vector labels (e.g. c("value" = "label", ...)). facet_ncol number columns facets. applies facet layout "wrap". facet_nrow number rows facets. applies facet layout "wrap". facet_scales Whether facet scales "fixed" across facets, "free" directions, free just one direction (.e. "free_x" "free_y"). Defaults "fixed". facet_space Whether facet space "fixed" across facets, "free" proportional directions, free proportional just one direction (.e. "free_x" "free_y"). Defaults "fixed". applies facet layout "grid" facet scales "fixed". facet_layout Whether layout "wrap" "grid". NULL single facet (facet2) argument provided, defaults "wrap". NULL facet facet2 arguments provided, defaults "grid". caption Caption title string. theme ggplot2 theme.

title: ggblanket 1.5.9000
text: Breaking: renamed add_tooltip_text add_tooltip changed output default column name “tooltip”. Breaking: coord argument removed. x y now uses limits also within coord clip defaulted “” oob set scales::oob_keep. Added clip argument. Made code gg_* function aesthetics default stat, position alpha. Made gg_blank powerful adding aesthetics . Made horizontal flipped plot x y scales work better. Fixed bug relating x y scale limits. Fixed bug relating free facet_scales. Fixed gg_bin2d gg_hex limits.

title: ggblanket 1.5.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-10-14 Breaking: redesigned gg_theme. Added automatic gridline removal. Added gg_bin2d function. Added gg_hex function. Added col_trans col_rescale arguments. Made col_legend_place default “r” numeric col variable. Made *_title = "" equivalent + labs(* = NULL). Supported x y datetime variables. Supported x y time variables. Redesigned internal code x, y col scales.

title: ggblanket 1.4.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-09-02 Breaking: Removed col_intervals argument. Breaking: Removed *_oob argument. Breaking: gg_theme, changed *_style arguments *_face. Breaking: gg_theme, changed font arguments family. Added gg_polygon function. Added col_continuous argument support colouring “steps”. Added col_legend_rev argument reverse legends. Added facet_layout argument faceting flexibility. Added facet_space argument support proportional facet panels. Removed width default. Improved default legend look continuous gradient. Improved scales y NULL plot horizontal. Fixed bug position = "fill". Updated messages. Added vignette.

title: ggblanket 1.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-08-05 Breaking: removed facet_intervals argument. Breaking: made extensive changes gg_theme function. Added facet2 aesthetic support effortless grid facetting. Changed default background theme colours. Fixed bug *_limits *_include working correctly. Added *_sec_axis arguments. Changed *_oob default scales::oob_keep. Removed reversal logical variable order. Defaulted col_legend_place "b".

title: ggblanket 1.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-07-01 Breaking: Removed *_breaks_n *_breaks_width. Added support *_breaks receive function. Added *_include argument. Added *_trans argument. Modified default x_breaks behaviour x y numeric date. Enhanced gg_blank work one x y. Provided support ggplotly. Added new add_tooltip_text function. Added new titles argument apply function across titles. Support gg_ functions working stats. Removed size argument, anticipation ggplot2 3.4.0. Updated gg_theme title vjust margins.

title: ggblanket 1.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-05-27 Remove default sentence case transformation categorical variable labels. Updated scales work consistent way position = "fill".
